availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund Cook, Jr. (Russell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Edmund Cook, Sr. and Nancy Cook. Married to Angeletta Blankenship Cook in Russell County on December 8, 1853. Father of Nancy C. Cook, William R. Cook, Abraham L. Cook, and M. G. Cook. Farmer in Russell County in 1850. Farmer in Russell County in 1860. Farmer in Russell County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District 2, p. 249B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 666.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Precinct 4, p.198B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Russell County, KY, February 1864, p. 70 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Russell County Marriages.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 211A.
